feature.name: Pitch Class Histogram
feature.description: A feature vector consisting of bin magnitudes of the pitch class histogram described in the jSymbolic manual. Each bin corresponds to one of the 12 pitch classes, ordered in increasing pitch with an interval of a semitone between each (enharmonic equivalents are assigned the same pitch class number). The first bin corresponds to the most common pitch class in the piece under consideration (it does NOT correspond to a set pitch class). The magnitude of of each bin is proportional to the the number of times notes occurred at the bin's pitch class in the piece, relative to all other pitch classes in the piece (the histogram is normalized).

feature.name: Number of Pitches
feature.description: Number of unique pitches that occur at least once in the piece. Enharmonic equivalents are grouped together for the purpose of this calculation.

feature.name: Number of Pitch Classes
feature.description: Number of pitch classes that occur at least once in the piece. Enharmonic equivalents are grouped together for the purpose of this calculation.

feature.name: Number of Common Pitch Classes
feature.description: Number of pitch classes that account individually for at least 20% of all notes. Enharmonic equivalents are grouped together for the purpose of this calculation.

feature.name: Range
feature.description: Difference in semitones between the highest and lowest pitches.

feature.name: Strong Tonal Centres
feature.description: Number of isolated peaks in the fifths pitch histogram that each individually account for at least 9% of all notes in the piece.

feature.name: Mean Pitch
feature.description: Mean MIDI pitch value, averaged across all pitched notes in the piece. Set to 0 if there are no pitched notes.

feature.name: Most Common Pitch
feature.description: MIDI pitch value of the most frequently occuring pitch.

feature.name: Most Common Pitch Class
feature.description: The pitch class that occurs most frequently compared to other pitch classes. A value of 0 corresponds to C, and pitches increase chromatically by semitone in integer untis (e.g. a value of 2 would mean that D is the most common pitch class). Enharmonic equivalents are treated as a single pitch class.

feature.name: Interval Between Most Prevalent Pitch Classes
feature.description: Absolute value of the difference (in semitones) between the pitches of the two most frequently occurring pitch classes.

feature.name: Pitch Variability
feature.description: Standard deviation of the MIDI pitches of all pitched notes in the piece. Provides a measure of how close the pitches as a whole are to the mean pitch.

feature.name: Last Pitch
feature.description: The MIDI pitch value of the last note in the piece. If there are multiple notes with simultaneous attacks at the end of the piece, then the one with the lowest pitch is selected. Set to 0 if there are no pitched notes.

feature.name: Most Common Melodic Interval
feature.description: Number of semitones corresponding to the most frequently occurring melodic interval.

feature.name: Mean Rhythmic Value
feature.description: The mean rhythmic value of the music, in quarter note units. So, for example, a Mean Rhythmic Value of 0.5 would mean that the duration of an eighth note corresponds to the mean average rhythmic value in the music. This calculation includes both pitched and unpitched notes, is calculated after rhythmic quantization, is not influenced by tempo, and is calculated without regard to the dynamics, voice or instrument of any given note.

feature.name: Most Common Rhythmic Value
feature.description: The most common rhythmic value of the music, in quarter note units. So, for example, a Most Common Rhythmic Value of 0.5 would mean that eighth notes occur more frequently than any other rhythmic value. This calculation includes both pitched and unpitched notes, is calculated after rhythmic quantization, is not influenced by tempo, and is calculated without regard to the dynamics, voice or instrument of any given note.
